title: JSON RPC - Fix differences between Nethermind and Infura (tested by flood)
body:
**Description**
In our PoC of flood we have noticed that we have a few differences between nethermind archive node (running on 1.19.3) and Infura endpoints.
below are more details about it:

1. eth_getLogs - Nethermind returns field "transactionLogIndex" which is not in Geth response
2. eth_getBlockByNumber - Nethermind returns field "author" which is not in Geth
3. eth_getBlockByHash - same as point 2
4. eth_getTransactionByHash - Nethermind retruns two fields "yParity" and "data" which are not in Geth. On the other hand, Geth has field "accessList" which is not in Nethermind
5. eth_feeHistory - Flood treats Geth "gasUsedRation" values in array as integers, where in Nethermind it treats them as floats
6. trace_block - multiple issues on few transactions - will describe in separate message
7. trace_call - different "gas" field value and different "from" field value
8. trace_callMany - same as point 7
9. trace_replayBlockTransactions - not existing method in geth
10. trace_replayTransaction - same as point 9

The file below is tests outcome from flood:
[infura vs nethermind.txt](https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/files/12013051/infura.vs.nethermind.txt)

below detailed logs from all requests and responses for both clients.
[infura.txt](https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/files/12013052/infura.txt)
